title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 485.8 - Denial of a request for a record
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 485.8 - Denial of a request for a record

State Regulations
(a) Denial of a request for records or
amendment or correction of a record or personal information: (1)
shall be in writing, explaining the
reasons therefor; and
(2)
identifying the person to whom an appeal may be directed. (b) A failure to grant or deny access to
records within five business days of the receipt of a request or within 30
business days of an acknowledgment of the receipt of a request, or a failure to
respond to a request for amendment or correction of a record within 30 business
days of receipt of such a request, shall be construed as a denial that may be
appealed. (c) Any such denial may
be appealed to: Assistant Deputy Superintendent-- Administration, Building 22, 1220 Washington Avenue, Albany, NY 12226-2252. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
485.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
